alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 03 at 1:01AM CDT until August 03 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by forecast excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, southwest Indiana and southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in southern Illinois, Edwards and Wabash. In southwest Indiana, Gibson, Pike, Spencer and Warrick. In southeast Missouri, Butler, Carter and Ripley. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The threat for training storms has increased which could lead to significant flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
